intro: Celsia syriaca, commonly known as the Syrian celsia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Celastraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Syria and adjacent areas in the Middle East. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a smooth surface and a slightly waxy texture. Celsia syriaca is often found in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
